attributes.action: Employers to give an average of hours if a business closes because of COVID-19
attributes.additional_details:
Hundreds if not thousands of families will be in debt if bills are suspended unless the Government annulled the bill costs most families could or will go bankrupt 

Giving a average of hours will allow retail and restaurant workers to pay bills and support their families 
These payments should not effect holiday or sickness allowance
attributes.background: The Retail and Restaurant industrys most workers have a low hour contract usually of 8 hours instead of contracted hours Employers must give a payment of an average amout of hours per month during the pandemic crisis if the business is forced to close

rejection.details:
The number of hours paid under a flexible contract is a matter for individual employers, not the Government or Parliament.

We have published a petition calling on the Government to implement Universal Basic Income to give home & food security through Covid-19, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302284

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
